physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hematocrit 37.7% (anemic range), Mean corpuscular volume 78 µm³/cell
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Mr. A appeared younger than his stated age, thin, and short. His mood was described as 'great,' although incongruent with his life situation. Affect was constricted and flat with occasional inappropriate large smiles. He was cooperative when not distracted, and speech was slow with many poorly pronounced words.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially uncooperative and mute, Mr. A began showing improvement in socialization over time with the addition of haloperidol, suggesting gradual recovery in social and affective functioning.
